intro: Diphyes serrulata, commonly known as the serrated diphyes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. The flowers are arranged in terminal clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
